Package me.hapyl.spigotutils.module.record

Class Record

java.lang.Object
me.hapyl.spigotutils.module.record.Record
public class Record extends Object
Records any action of a player and allows to replay them using NPC. This includes: - Location. - Equipment. - Poses, such as: --- Sneaking --- Sleeping --- Swimming Not implemented: (mark as todo) - Taking damage. - Swinging hands.

  • Constructor Details

    • Record

      public Record(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)

  • Method Details

    • startRecording

      public void startRecording()
      Stars recording of this replay is not already finished. Cannot be called if {@link this#isRecordFinished()} is true. Will override ongoing recording if exists.

    • stopRecording

      public void stopRecording()
      Stops recording os this Record. Recording must be stopped before Replay can to played.

    • newReplay

      public Replay newReplay()
      Returns new Replay which is NOT linked to this Record.
      Returns:
      new replay.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if called before recording is finished.

    • getReplay

      @Nonnull public Replay getReplay()
      Returns Replay of this Record which is linked to this record and may only exist in one instance.
      Returns:
      replay of this record.

    • isRecordingInProgress

      public boolean isRecordingInProgress()
      Returns true recording is in progress, false otherwise.
      Returns:
      true recording is in progress, false otherwise.

    • getPlayer

      public org.bukkit.entity.Player getPlayer()
      Returns player of this record.
      Returns:
      player of this record.

    • getFrames

      public int getFrames()
      Returns current amount of frames recorded in ticks.
      Returns:
      current amount of frames recorded in ticks.

    • isMaxFrames

      public boolean isMaxFrames()
      Returns true if amount of frames recorded is equals or greater than maximum allowed, or maxFrames is 0, false otherwise.
      Returns:
      Returns true if amount of frames recorded is equals or greater than maximum allowed, or maxFrames is 0, false otherwise.

    • getMaxFrames

      public long getMaxFrames()
      Returns maximum amount of frames allowed for this record in ticks.
      Returns:
      maximum amount of frames allowed for this record in ticks.

    • isRecordFinished

      public boolean isRecordFinished()
      Returns true if recording is finished. Plugin should call this method before calling {@link this#getReplay()} or {@link this#newReplay()}
      Returns:
      true if recording is finished.

    • setMaxFrames

      public void setMaxFrames(long frames)
      Changes maximum amount of frames allowed to this record in ticks. Default is 6000, maximum is 72000.
      Parameters:
      frames - - new maximum amount.

    • getData

      @Nonnull public Data getData(long frame)
      Returns data at provided frame, or creates new data if null.
      Parameters:
      frame - - frame (tick) of data.
      Returns:
      data at provided frame, or creates new data if null.

      @Nonnull public Data getDataAtNextFrame()
      Returns data of the next frame, or creates new data if null.
      Returns:
      data of the next frame, or creates new data if null.

    • getReplay

      @Nullable public static Record getReplay(org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
      Returns stored replay of a player if exists, null otherwise. Note that only one replay can be stored at the time, though any amount of replaying can be recording at the same time.
      Parameters:
      player - - Player.
      Returns:
      stored replay of a player if exists, null otherwise.
